param.name: pseudospectra

param.help: A table containing the association statistics that define pseudospectra.

param.name: parameters
param.label: Parameters

param.name: correlation
param.label: Feature-Feature Correlation Matrix
param.help: The correlation matrix needs to be provided only if metabomatching is set to use decorrelation.

tool.help:
----------- Description -----------
Metabomatching identifies metabolites using genetic spiking.
A basic description is provided below, full documentation here https://github.com/rrueedi/metabomatching/blob/master/documentation/howto.pdf
----------- Input Files -----------
**Pseudospectra (Association Statistics)** | This (1+3K)-column tab-separated file contains the association statistics (effect size, standard error, and *p*-value) for the K variables on which metabomatching is to be run |
**Parameters** | This two-column tab-separated file controls both the way metabomatching is run and the way results are displayed. |
**Feature-Feature Correlation Matrix** | This comma-separated file contains the feature-feature correlation matrix. This file is necessary only when metabomatching is to be run with decorrelation (in Parameters, decorr_lambda strictly smaller than 1). |
**Test Files** | The following two files can be downloaded from GitHub, then uploaded via *Get Data* to run metabomatching on test data. | pseudospectra file: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rrueedi/metabomatching/master/test/ps.test.multi/test.pseudospectrum.tsv | parameters file: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rrueedi/metabomatching/master/test/parameters.gxy.1.tsv |
------------ Output Files ------------
**Scores** | This (3+K)-column tab-separated file contains the metabomatching scores for the K provided pseudospectra, with one row for each reference metabolite. |
**Figure (PDF)** | The results, presented as a K page PDF file. |
